newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan builders' June orders fall 2.6% yr/yr - group.
newsitem.headline: Japan builders' June orders fall 2.6% yr/yr - group.

text.p: Orders received by Japan's major construction companies in June fell 2.6 percent year-on-year to 1.35 trillion yen, the Japan Federation of Construction Contractors said on Thursday.
The survey covered 63 builders, all of which are large contractors.
Orders received in the April-June quarter fell 5.2 percent from the same period a year ago to 3.59 trillion yen, the industry group said in a statement.
It added that the April-June figure was the lowest for a first fiscal quarter since 1987.
In June, orders received in Japan fell 0.5 percent to 1.30 trillion yen, the federation said.
Of that amount, public-sector orders totalled 460 billion yen, up 3.4 percent from a year ago, while private-sector orders fell 2.2 percent year-on-year to 839 billion yen, the industry group said.
The contractors received 47 billion yen in orders from abroad in June, down 39.0 percent from a year ago, the industry group said.
